articles.title: Karen Hao Empowers Journalists To Unravel AI’s Complexities And Impacts
articles.description: Karen Hao encourages journalists to look at AI not as just a technological advancement but as a force “reshaping the power dynamics and societal structures.” As AI evolves, so must the approaches to reporting on it.
articles.content: I awoke at the early hours of 4:00 am EDT to attend the first, in the series of online courses for AI Spotlight series which was hosted by Karen Hao, contributor for The Atlantic, and former foreign c... [15750 symbols]

entities.data: the early hours of 4:00 am EDT
Artificial Intelligence is Creating a New Colonial World Order
Beyond the Hype: Uncovering the Real AI Stories

articles.summary: Karen Hao, contributor for The Atlantic and former foreign correspondent at The Wall Street Journal, has hosted online courses for the AI Spotlight series aimed at empowering journalists to understand the complexities of artificial intelligence and its impacts on society and business. The series aims to provide a crucial understanding of AI's role in shaping power dynamics and societal structures. Hao highlighted the complexity of AI, which includes a wide range of techniques and approaches from simple machine learning algorithms to complex deep neural networks, and the potential for journalists to accurately report these developments accurately. She also highlighted the increasing centralization of authority as Big Tech increases at the expense of emerging innovation. The AI Spotlight Series aims to help journalists understand the implications of AI and its role in informing the public about these developments.

articles.title: Russian and Chinese nuclear-capable bombers patrol near United States
articles.description: “The Russian and PRC aircraft remained in international airspace and did not enter American or Canadian sovereign airspace,” NORAD said.
articles.content: Russian and Chinese nuclear-capable strategic bombers patrolled near the U.S. state of Alaska in the North Pacific and Arctic on Thursday, the two countries said, a move that prompted the United State... [1825 symbols]
articles.summary: Russian and Chinese nuclear-capable strategic bombers patrolled near the U.S. state of Alaska in the North Pacific and Arctic, prompting the United States and Canada to scramble fighter jets. Russian Tu-95MS “Bear” strategic bombers and Chinese Xi’an H-6 strategic bombers took part in patrols over the Chukchi and Bering seas and the North Ocean. The Russian and Chinese bombers were escorted by Russian Sukhoi Su-30SM and Su-35S fighters, and no foreign airspace was violated. The North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) confirmed that the Russian and People’s Republic of China (PRC) aircraft remained in international airspace and did not enter American or Canadian sovereign airspace. The joint patrol had deepened strategic mutual trust and coordination between the two militaries.

articles.title: 10 best tripods for outdoor photography
articles.description: Once you experience the benefits of working with a tripod, you’ll immediately understand why choosing the right one is so important.

articles.summary: A reliable tripod is a crucial piece of gear for outdoor photographers, particularly for low-light photography. The best tripod for outdoor photography requires special consideration, with leg flexibility, stability, flexibility, and durability essential. Professional tripods are the most expensive, often made out of premium aluminum or carbon fiber, and are often built to high standards. They are also often marketed to established shutterbugs and often don't include any mounting accessories. Hobbyist tripods, often smaller and cheaper, are the best choices for most photographers. Mini and travel tripods can be purchased for less than half the cost, often designed to accommodate a lightweight digital camera or smartphone. The article also lists the 10 best tripods for outdoor photo.

(NASDAQ:NVDA) have seen a surge in share prices due to the growing popularity of the generative artificial intelligence market. AMD's shares have risen more than 20% year to date, but still trailed significantly behind Nvidia's (up roughly 168%), which has surpassed expectations. Despite lagging behind Nvidia in its GPU offerings, AMD is positioned as a strong contender in the AI chipset market. The company manufactures a suite of semiconductor products, including GPUs and data center chips with AI applications, which is expected to drive strong growth. Despite intense competition, AMD believes the industry's growth will allow both companies to achieve significant growth in the coming years.

articles.title: AI Energizes Your Career Path & Charts Your Professional Growth Plan

articles.summary: AI has become a vital tool in shaping careers, providing innovative ways to learn, improve, and excel in various professions. One of the most significant impacts is in personalized education and skill development, tailoring learning experiences to individuals' needs, goals, and learning styles. AI platforms like Coursera and Udemy use machine learning algorithms to offer personalized course recommendations based on users' interests, previous courses, and job market trends. AI virtual mentors, like BetterUp or Sana Labs, provide personalized coaching and career advice. Platforms like LinkedIn match job seekers with relevant opportunities and companies are using AI tools like Fama to improve their work style and corporate cultural fits of job candidates. However, ethical issues regarding data privacy and security and the use of AI in career development need to be addressed.

articles.title: Are you suffering from Shiny Object Syndrome?
articles.description: By Amanda Kavanagh Tech workers must constantly upskill, so it’s especially easy to get caught up in the whirlwind of new frameworks, technologies, and methodologies. … The post Are you suffering from Shiny Object Syndrome? appeared first on BGR.
articles.content:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, BGR may receive an affiliate commission.

Tech workers must constantly upskill, so it’s especially easy to g... [6090 symbols]
articles.summary: The article discusses the phenomenon of "Shiny Object Syndrome" in tech, where technology workers constantly strive for the next big thing and constantly upskill. This obsession can lead to a tendency to invest in new frameworks, technologies, and methodologies, leading to a focus on learning skills that may not align with your long-term goals or your company's needs. Instead of developing deep expertise in areas that matter to your role and company, you might find yourself with a scattered skillset. The article also discusses the need for a more strategic approach to develop these skillset, which can make them more valuable long-range. The author also highlights the need to consider the implementation of AI in carefully and avoid it from over-across industries.

articles.summary: The world's largest edtech competition, The Fourth Annual Tools Competition, has awarded over $8 million to teams developing learning tools that promise to transform education globally. The competition is a multi-million dollar funding opportunity for edtech innovation that uses digital technology, big data, and learning science to meet learners' needs. In total, 50 winners from 18 countries will receive more than $8m, reaching an estimated 24 million learners globally. Winning ideas include AI-powered simulators for teachers-in-training, chatbots for students, and expanded data sets for researchers studying education. The Tools Competition partnered with OpenAI to offer the OpenAI Learning Impact Prize for teams using the power of AI to accelerate educational progress, particularly in underserved communities. This year's competition saw nearly 2,000 submissions from 92 countries, with winners from institutions and organizations across all continents.

articles.title: You can now return books and other items to Seattle Public Library
articles.description: A ransomware attack had shut down much of the library's computer system for nearly two months.
articles.content:
Nearly two months after a ransomware attack shut down much of its system, Seattle Public Library is now processing returns.

“We are hard at work processing books and restocking our shelves,” the libr... [889 symbols]
articles.summary: Seattle Public Library, nearly two months after a cyber attack that shut down much of its system, is now processing returns for books and other items. The library does not require immediate returns, any item checked out prior to Aug. 31 and does not charge fines. The staff is working on processing books and restocking shelves, and the library will not charge overdue fines. Self-checkout and the ability to place physical physical holds on physical items is expected soon, with the library's Wi-Fi available, but free printing services have been temporarily halted due to a CrowdStrike tech outage. The computers are expected to resume operations in mid- to late-August.

articles.title: Spotify wants its podcasters to embrace video. Here are 3 strategies for success with the format, according to creators who use it
articles.description: Content creators Colin Rosenblum and Samir Chaudry shared their top strategies for video podcasts on Spotify.
articles.content: Spotify is trying to get more podcasters to use video as it chases huge growth in that corner of the industry and competes with rivals like YouTube.On Thursday, July 25, the streaming company is hosti... [1974 symbols]
articles.summary: Spotify is hosting a free online masterclass for podcast creators on July 25 for its strategy to increase their use of video in the industry. The event will include a Q&A on best practices for video podcasts with Jordan Newman, senior director of creator partnerships at Spotify, and content creators Colin Rosenblum and Samir Chaudry. The company has been investing in podcasting and the creator experience as it positions itself as a creator platform. It has also been growing its video podcasting business, with over 250,000 video podcasts on the platform and over 170 million global users watching a video podcast on Spotify.

articles.title: 100,000 people join group to mock Tesla Cybertruck
articles.description: CyberStuck is among the top 2 per cent of forums on Reddit
articles.content:
An online forum dedicated to mocking the Tesla Cybertruck has attracted more than 110,000 members following four recalls of the electric truck.

The r/CyberStuck channel on Reddit is now among the top... [2261 symbols]
articles.summary: The r/CyberStuck forum on Reddit, dedicated to mocking the Tesla Cybertruck, has attracted over 110,000 members following four recalls of the electric truck. The channel is now among the top 2% of sub-Reddits on the site, less than a year after the controversial truck hit the market. The forum encourages members to share images and videos of Tesla's newest vehicle breaking down or failing to cope with off-road situations. The most popular post on the sub-Reddit, which has been upvoted more than 34,000 times, criticises the boxy design and inability to perform tasks like driving on sand or ice. Founder Alex Beattie, who created the forum in December 2023, stated that he did not intend to attack Tesla or its CEO Elon Musk.

articles.title: Common Samsung battery boosting button hides extra power saving abilities
articles.description: BATTERY is always the biggest worry for smartphone users. How long will it last? Can I get more power out of it? Fortunately there are a growing number of tools to help users squeeze out as much po…
articles.content:
BATTERY is always the biggest worry for smartphone users.

How long will it last? Can I get more power out of it?

Fortunately there are a growing number of tools to help users squeeze out as much pow... [2509 symbols]
articles.summary: Samsung has a number of features for its Android users to boost the lifespan of their battery, including a battery protection option that prevents the battery from continuing to charge once it reaches its maximum of 100%. The company insider has revealed that a common Samsung battery boosting button hides additional power saving abilities. Users can also control how fast their device is, which increases processing power and battery consumption, and how battery life can be managed. The company's battery protection can be changed by going to Settings > Device care > Battery > Battery, or changing the battery's charge level to prevent it from recharging once it hits its maximum. Other features include an ability to disable always on display while asleep or use maximum power saving while awake.

articles.title: Elgato transforms its Stream Deck Plus with new XLR and USB dock accessories
articles.description: Both new accessories are available to purchase now.
articles.content: Elgato is launching two new docks for its Stream Deck Plus device that can add XLR microphone support or a USB hub. The Stream Deck Plus originally launched in 2022 with the usual Stream Deck buttons,... [1628 symbols]
articles.summary: Elgato is launching two new docks for its Stream Deck Plus device that can add XLR microphone support or a USB hub. The $119.99 XLR Dock can deliver up to 75dB of gain, enough to power Shure's SM7B microphone, and even has a headphone jack for zero latency monitoring. The USB hub also includes two USB-C ports, two USB A ports, an SD or Micro SD card reader, and a 65-watt uplink port to charge your laptop if connected to an external power supply.

articles.title: McDonald's says Japan glitch was not tied to CrowdStrike outage
articles.description: “This feels like episode of Mr. Robot,” one user said on social media as McDonald's kiosks went down
articles.content: The massive outage was caused by a mishandled software update from cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike. The glitch has caused major disruptions for numerous industries and companies, including airlines lik... [2137 symbols]
articles.summary: McDonald's Japan has reported a systems outage that was unrelated to the CrowdStrike outage, caused by a mishandled software update from cybersecurity firm. The issue affected the chain's cash registers, forcing only Teriyaki and McChicken sandwiches to be ordered using cash. McDonald's is investigating the cause and a timeline for recovery is unclear. This is not the first time McDonald's has faced a system outage this year, following a similar issue in March which forced the chain to close locations in Japan, Australia, and the UK. Starbucks is also being affected by the outage, with roughly 82% of users reporting an inability to order via the coffee chain's app.

articles.title: IBM stock rises after Q2 beat enhanced by AI bookings
articles.description: IBM's (IBM) AI bookings grew by over $2 billion in the second quarter, contributing to its earnings beat reported on Wednesday. Synovus vice president and senior portfolio manager Dan Morgan told Yahoo Finance that International Business Machines just has "a different strategy towards AI and cloud than a lot of these other companies do." The Morning Brief team examines IBM's earnings figures out from its software and generative AI segments. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Morning Brief. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

The company's strategy towards AI and cloud is different from many other companies, according to Synovus vice president and senior portfolio manager Dan Morgan. The Morning Brief team examines IBM's earnings figures from its software and generative AI segments.

articles.authorsByline: AP Business Writer, By KELVIN CHAN
articles.title: Meta's Oversight Board says deepfake policies need update and response to explicit image fell short
articles.description: Meta's Oversight Board says the company failed to take down an AI-generated intimate image...
articles.content: FILE - The Meta logo is seen at the Vivatech show in Paris, France, Wednesday, June 14, 2023. Meta failed to take down an AI-generated intimate image of an Indian female public figure that violated it... [3003 symbols]
articles.summary: Meta's Oversight Board has stated that the social media company's deepfake policies need to be updated and that it failed to remove an AI-generated intimate image of an Indian female public figure that violated its policies until the company's review board intervened. The board, which was established in 2020 to review content on its platforms including Facebook and Instagram, found that in one case, the company failed to take down an image of a famous Indian woman, whom it did not identify, until the review board got involved. In another case, an image depicting two American women nude and being groped were posted to a Facebook group but were later removed due to their already in the database. The Oversight Board also expressed concern over the company’s policy wording and recommended replacing the word “derogatory” with a different term like “non-consensual” and specifying that the rule covers a wide range of editing and media manipulation techniques.

articles.title: How Avon International Enhances Global Demand Planning With Blue Yonder’s AI Tools
articles.description: Avon International implemented Blue Yonder's solutions to create an end-to-end next-generation supply chain while also supporting its vision and consumers.
articles.content:
As self care and wellness become more important to consumers, the cosmetic industry is experiencing significant growth worldwide.

In fact, despite a brief setback in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic... [4759 symbols]

keywords.name: supply chain management company Blue Yonder

articles.summary: Avon International has partnered with supply chain management company Blue Yonder to enhance its global demand planning and operational efficiency. The New York-based beauty empire integrated Blue Yond’s Cognitive Demand Planning, Enterprise Supply Planning and Control Tower solutions to create an end-to-end next-generation supply chain. These solutions use advanced artificial intelligence and machine-learning capabilities to streamline demand planning, enhance decision-making agility and adapt to market dynamics. The partnership also allows Avon to develop forecasts incorporating causal variables such as campaigns, pricing, promotions, catalogue positioning and seasonality, which are often difficult to manage with traditional time-series modeling. Additionally, the partnership includes extensive training programs tailored to Avon's needs and ongoing support from Avon team members to ensure effective use of the supply chain solutions.

articles.title: HARMAN Awarded JLR’s Global Supplier Excellence Award for Integrity

HARMAN is recognized for continued demonstration of exceptional collaboration and values

articles.summary: HARMAN has been awarded JLR's Global Supplier Excellence Award for Integrity for its exceptional collaboration with JLR. The award recognises HARMAN's ability to deliver a best in class Over-The-Air (OTA) solution. The annual Global Suitable Awards celebrated the collective contribution and impact of JLR’s supply base towards achieving a robust global supply chain. HARMAN was among six winners for demonstrating J LR's Creators' Code values in their daily operations. The accolade underscores HARMAN’S expertise as a provider of advanced software services. In March 2017, HARMAN became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.

articles.title: FINBOA Recognized as Finalist in 2024 Finovate Awards 'Best Back-Office/Core Solutions' Category
articles.description: FINBOA Inc., a leading innovator in intelligent process automation software for financial institutions, has been named as a finalist in the 2024 Finovate Awards in the Best Back-Office/Core Services Solution.
articles.content: HOUSTON, July 25, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- FINBOA Inc., a leading innovator in intelligent process automation software for financial institutions, has been named as a finalist in the in the Best Back-Offi... [2317 symbols]
articles.summary: FINBOA Inc., a leading innovator in intelligent process automation software for financial institutions, has been named as a finalist in the 2024 Finovate Awards 'Best Back-Office/Core Services Solution' category for its innovative solution, which improves regulatory compliance and operational efficiency by eliminating manual systems and processes associated with dispute resolution. The awards recognise financial technology companies that are leading banks, fintech firms, accelerators, and individuals in 24 categories representing innovation in the financial services industry. FINBOA's SaaS solutions offer data integration with most banking core systems, are PCI/DSS compliant, and easy-to-use. The company's mission is to replace manual compliance processing with intelligent automation and decisioning, allowing financial institutions to reduce operational costs and risk.

articles.title: TCS Breaks New Ground With Generative AI Summer Camp for Students Aged 11–17
articles.description: NORTHAMPTON, MA / ACCESSWIRE / July 25, 2024 / Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) Seeking to help prepare members of the future global workforce in the effective and responsible use of generative AI (GenAI), Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) recently held ...
articles.content: Seeking to help prepare members of the future global workforce in the effective and responsible use of generative AI (GenAI), Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) recently held a summer camp to train middl... [5464 symbols]

entities.data: goIT Digital Innovation and Career Readiness Program

articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has introduced a pilot program for middle and high school students aged 11-17 at a summer camp in Milford, Ohio, aimed to train them in the effective and responsible use of generative AI (GenAI). The camp, held from June 4-6, is one of the first examples in the U.S. of a technology industry leader incorporating GenAI into STEM education for middle/high school students. The initiative aligns with the state of Ohio's recent release of guidelines for using AI in classrooms. Participants were taught about the importance of Responsible AI and explored how to use GenAI to solve some of the world's most pressing problems. The camp also introduced and tested its new GenAI Technology Learning Pathway. TCS plans to use this information to apply to future AI-related student programming.

articles.title: Wall Streeters sound off on their use of AI. But the real test will be if the tech can make their firms more money.
articles.description: Not unlike the workers it's looking to serve, gen AI's future on Wall Street will boil down to its ability to produce results.
articles.content: Hello! The iPhone could reportedly get a major redesign to turn it into a…flip phone. What year are we living in?In today's big story, dozens of Wall Street employees open up about how they are (or ar... [3033 symbols]
articles.summary: Business Insider's finance team interviewed nearly three dozen Wall Street employees about their use of AI in their roles. The article suggests that the real test will be if the tech can make their firms more money by improving their bottom line. While some finance workers believe that AI can help them perform faster, easier, or both, others are skeptical about the potential breakthroughs in AI. The future of AI on Wall Street will depend on its ability to produce results, which comes with significant costs. Blackstone expects the US to spend roughly $1 trillion over the next five years building and facilitating new data centers that will power the gen AI wave. Meanwhile, Goldman expects the market to watch if AI spend can translate to revenue.

articles.summary: Meta's Oversight Board has issued a statement stating that its deepfake policies need to be updated and that it failed to remove an AI-generated intimate image of an Indian female public figure that violated its policies until the company's review board intervened. The board, which was established in 2020 to serve as a referee for content on its platforms, found that in one case, the user reported the image as pornography but it was not reviewed within a 48 hour deadline. The second case involved an image showing two American women nude and being groped being posted to a Facebook group, which were already in the database. The Oversight Board expressed concern over Meta's response to the Indian woman's inclusion in its image database and suggested that its policy wording was unclear and that replacing the word "derogatory" with a different term like "non-consensual".

articles.title: Halifax horror as fraudsters steal 'massive' amount but support line is closed
articles.description: They tried phoning up many times but all the lines were closed.
articles.content: A Halifax customer reached out to the bank desparate for help as fraudsters had stolen a large amount of cash from their account. They contacted the bank over X after struggling to get through on the ... [2581 symbols]
articles.summary: A Halifax customer was left desperate for help after fraudsters had stolen a significant amount of cash from their account. The customer contacted the bank over X after struggling to get through on the phone and found that their 24-hour fraud support lines were closed. The bank assured them they had a fraud team on hand 24/7 to help with queries, but the customer complained that the bank's 'Contact us about fraud' page on their website was closed. They also asked if they needed help with an issue regarding a current account issue. A representative from the bank assured the customer that they could call the fraud team 24/07 on 0800 500 3996. However, the customer disputed this, stating that this number is not the correct contact details for the Fraud team.

articles.content:
As part of that departure, East Buy agreed to sell Dong’s namesake venture – called Time with Yuhui – to the influencer for 76.6 million yuan (US$10.5 million), according to a separate filing.

The 31... [2292 symbols]

companies.name: New Oriental Education & Technology Group Inc.

articles.summary: China's top live-streaming influencer, Dong Yuhui, has left East Buy, the e-commerce arm of New Oriental Education & Technology Group (New Oriental), to focus on his own venture, Time with YuhUI. This departure marks one of the most striking exits in the sector, sending East Buy's shares down in pre-trading. As part of Dong's departure, East Buy agreed to sell Dong's namesake venture for 76.6 million yuan (US$10.5 million). The company plans to buy back up to 500 million yuan of shares over a one-year period. Dong, a former teacher who gained fame and wealth in China’s live-commerce sector, is one of China's most popular live-Streaming live-starors.

articles.title: Meta's Oversight Board says deepfake policies need update and response to explicit image fell short
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Meta's policies on non-consensual deepfake images need updating, including wording that’s “not sufficiently clear," the company's oversight panel said Thursday in a decision on cases involving AI-generated explicit depictions of two famous women.
articles.content: The board, which Meta set up in 2020 to serve as a referee for content on its platforms including Facebook and Instagram, has spent months reviewing the two cases involving AI-generated images depicti... [2833 symbols]
articles.summary: Meta's Oversight Board, set up in 2020, has called for an update to its deepfake policies regarding content on its platforms including Facebook and Instagram, stating that their response to explicit images fell short. The board, which has reviewed two cases involving AI-generated images depicting famous women, one Indian and one American, found that their actions were inadequate. One case involved an image posted on Instagram depicting a nude Indian woman with her face visible and another showing an American woman being groped. Both images violated Meta’s ban on “derogatory sexualized photoshop” under its bullying and harassment policy, but the board noted that its policy wording was unclear and recommended replacing the word “Derogatory” with a different term like “non-consensual” and specifying that the rule covers a broad range of editing and media manipulation techniques that go beyond “photoshop.” The board also expressed concern over Meta”s auto-closing of appeals image-based sexual abuse after 48 hours, which could have a significant human rights impact.

articles.title: Ofcom reveals the most complained-about broadband provider
articles.description: O2 remains the most complained-about mobile operator
articles.content:
The most complained-about broadband and landline provider in the latest quarterly figures from regulator Ofcom has been revealed.

The provider Now received 22 complaints per 100,000 subscribers betwe... [2885 symbols]
articles.summary: Ofcom has revealed that Now is the most complained-about broadband and landline provider in the UK, with 22 complaints per 100,000 subscribers, above the industry average of 11. Now received 12 complaints for its landline service, followed by EE and Virgin Media, with both companies on 11 complaints. While these complaints were mainly driven by how they handled complaints, EE's complaints were primarily about faults, service and getting services connected. Utility Warehouse generated the fewest complaints for landline services, while Sky and Shell Energy were the least complained about broadband providers. O2 remains the most-complained mobile operator. Complaints about landline, fixed broadband and pay-TV all fell while complaints about mobile services increased slightly.

articles.title: Stock market news today: US stocks steady after steep Big Tech-led sell-off
articles.description: Earnings misses have put the spotlight on the health of the economy after a Big Tech-led sell-off.
articles.content:
US stocks steadied ahead of the bell Thursday, as investors regrouped after a Big Tech-led wipeout inspired by AI doubts.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) opened flat, while the S&P 500 (^GSPC... [2003 symbols]

keywords.name: first quarter US gross domestic product

articles.summary: US stocks have steadied ahead of the bell following a steep sell-off by Big Tech companies due to AI doubts. The Dow Jones Industrial Average opened flat and the S&P 500 also held steady, while the Nasdaq Composite rose slightly. Concerns are growing about the future of tech companies' large investments in AI, which have been disappointing recently. This led to a drop in confidence in the industry, leading to the downfall of the Stoxx 600 (^STOXX) and Nikkei 225 (^N225), leading to a 3-plus loss at the close. However, concerns are also emerging about the robustness of the US economy, with an advance estimate showing the economy grew at an annualized pace of 2.8% in Q1.

articles.title: One of China’s ‘AI tigers’ raises another US$700 million from Big Tech
articles.description: The Beijing-based company is now worth more than US$2.7 billion, behind only fellow ‘AI tiger’ Moonshot AI, as US capital remains sparse in the domestic industry.
articles.content: China International Capital Corporation, the AI industrial investment fund backed by the municipal governments of Beijing and Shanghai, as well as Shenzhen Capital Group, one of the largest yuan-denom... [2542 symbols]
articles.summary: Chinese tech company Baichuan AI, one of China's 'artificial intelligence tigers', has raised another US$700 million from major tech companies including Alibaba Group Holding Tencent Holdings and Xiaomi, as well as state-backed funds. The funding round was part of China International Capital Corporation, the AI industrial investment fund backed by the municipal governments of Beijing and Shanghai, Shenzhen Capital Group, and one of the largest yuan-denominated venture funds established by the southern tech hub’s government in 1999. The company, founded in April 2023 by Wang Xiaochuan, has seen its valuation rise past US$2.7 billion within months, becoming China's second-most valuable AI start-up behind rival Moonshot AI. This investment round shows local investors continue to invest in the AI industry despite US funds avoiding significant action due to geopolitical uncertainty.

articles.title: Oracle signs deal to use Italy's Rai Way data centres
articles.description: Oracle has signed an accord with Rai Way to install its systems for artificial intelligence applications at the Italian infrastructure firm's data centres, the two companies said on Thursday.  Oracle's corporate clients will be able to access Oracle's database solutions, cloud options and disaster recovery technologies at Rai Way's data centres, some of which are remotely located.  The companies said such data centres, located in more remote areas than the main cloud infrastructure hubs in the country, were particularly useful for cybersecurity services because that added "a further layer of protection against any attempts by cyber-criminals to locate data geographically."
articles.content: MILAN (Reuters) - Oracle has signed an accord with Rai Way to install its systems for artificial intelligence applications at the Italian infrastructure firm's data centres, the two companies said on ... [989 symbols]
articles.summary: Oracle has signed a deal with Rai Way to install its systems for artificial intelligence applications at the Italian infrastructure firm's data centres. The deal allows Oracle's corporate clients to access Oracle's database solutions, cloud options, and disaster recovery technologies at these locations. The data centres, located in remote areas, are particularly useful for cybersecurity services as they provide additional protection against cyber-criminals' attempts to locate data. Rai Way's main asset is the broadcasting infrastructure of Italian state television RAI. However, the company is aiming to diversify by building a carrier-neutral network of data centres in Italy connected through a proprietary fibre optic network.

articles.title: Council Post: The Advantages Of Unmanned Blimps As Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs)
articles.description: Whether for commercial, scientific or environmental purposes, the advantages of blimps as portable unmanned vehicles are clear and compelling.
articles.content: In the rapidly evolving landscape of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), quadcopters have become synonymous with innovation and versatility. However, an equally compelling yet often overlooked alternativ... [6714 symbols]
articles.summary: Unmanned blimps, or portable drones, have several advantages over traditional quadcopters, particularly when used as portable vehicles. These include a stable flight experience due to their smaller surface area and slower propulsion requirements, which are particularly beneficial for applications such as aerial photography, mapping, and scientific observations. The buoyant nature of these blims allows them to stay airborne for extended missions, particularly in environmental monitoring, agricultural surveillance and data collection tasks. Their lower operational costs and energy efficiency can result in less frequent maintenance, battery changes, and other operational interruptions. However, there are challenges and considerations such as noise pollution, weather conditions, and training for operators.

articles.description: Dr. Pip Clery of UCL Wins Prestigious Research Award for Study Conducted with data from juli AI-Powered App Association between temperature and depression This groundbreaking study on the impact of outdoor ambient temperature on mental health by Dr. Pip Clery from University College London (UCL) has been awarded the 2024 Royal College of Psychiatrists International Congress poster prize in the Research category. Boston, July 25, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Dr. Pip Clery from University College Lond
articles.content:
Dr. Pip Clery of UCL Wins Prestigious Research Award for Study Conducted with data from juli AI-Powered App

Boston, July 25, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Dr. Pip Clery from University College London (UCL... [3405 symbols]

entities.data: The association between outdoor ambient temperature and depression and mania

articles.summary: Dr. Pip Clery from University College London (UCL) has won the 2024 Royal College of Psychiatrists International Congress poster prize for her study on the impact of outdoor ambient temperature on mental health. The research, conducted with data from juli AI-Powered App, used to explore the relationship between temperature changes and mental health symptoms. The study found that every degree increase in temperature correlated with a reduction in depressive symptoms and an increase in manic symptoms, even after accounting for other weather variables and personal characteristics. This is the first study to use geolocated weather data on a large scale to examine mental health effects. The implications of the study are far-reaching, offering a critical perspective on environmental changes and the potential for future research and interventions to mitigate the adverse effects of climate.

articles.title: Apple's China smartphone shipments drop 6.7% as Huawei surges, data shows
articles.description: BEIJING (Reuters) -Apple's smartphone shipments in China fell by 6.7% in the second quarter of 2024, as the tech giant faced intensifying competition from rivals like Huawei, according to data from market research firm Canalys.  Apple's total shipments for the quarter ending in June stood at 9.7 million units, down from 10.4 million units in the same quarter last year, Canalys data shows.  In contrast, Huawei's smartphone shipments surged 41% year-on-year to 10.6 milion in the quarter, bolstered by the launch of its new Pura 70 series in April.

articles.summary: Apple's smartphone shipments in China fell by 6.7% in the second quarter of 2024, according to data from market research firm Canalys. This comes as Apple's total shipments for the quarter ending in June were at 9.7 million units, down from 10.4 million units in the same quarter last year. In contrast, Huawei's shipments surged 41% year-on-year to 10.6 million units boosted by the launch of its new Pura 70 series. Apple's market share decreased from 16% to 14%, and its ranking in the Chinese smartphone market fell from third to sixth place. China's smartphone shipment rose by 10% in Q2, with Vivo being the top vendor with a share of 19%, followed by Oppo, Honor and Huawei.

articles.title: Marvell Announces Immediate Availability of Open Ecosystem Software for Teralynx 10 51.2T Switch
articles.description: Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: MRVL), a leader in data infrastructure semiconductor solutions, today announced the immediate availability of the Marvell® Teralynx® 10 51.2 Tbps Ethernet switch device in the Linux Foundation's SONiC (Software for Open Networking in the Cloud) network operating system. With this public release, leading networking vendors can now use and deploy Teralynx 10-based systems in SONiC environments.
articles.content:
Marvell ® Teralynx ® 10 switch now available in Linux Foundation's open-source SONiC, capitalizing on market shift to open network platforms

SANTA CLARA, Calif., July 25, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Marvell... [5002 symbols]
articles.summary: Marvell Technology, a leader in data infrastructure semiconductor solutions, has announced the immediate availability of the Marvell® Teralynx® 10 51.2 Tbps Ethernet switch device in the Linux Foundation's SONiC network operating system. This move capitalizes on a market shift towards open network platforms, which allows cloud data center operators to tailor their networking systems for specific use cases, develop faster, and adopt diverse silicon vendors. The Tralynx 10 device is a programmable 51.3 Tbps switch with the industry's lowest published latency. Marvell has been an active member of SONIC, holding a governing board position and seats on multiple technical committees including chairing the platform working group.

articles.title: 6 Amazon Subscriptions That Will Save You Money Long-Term
articles.description: It's no secret that an Amazon Prime subscription can save you money on shipping and handling, especially if you're a frequent online shopper. But did you know that you can also sign up for...
articles.content: It’s no secret that an Amazon Prime subscription can save you money on shipping and handling, especially if you’re a frequent online shopper. But did you know that you can also sign up for subscriptio... [5320 symbols]
articles.summary: Amazon is a platform that allows users to sign up for subscriptions and recurring memberships that can save money long-term. An Amazon Prime membership costs $14.99 a month or $139 a year, but can also be signed up for free premium food delivery subscriptions. Subscriptions include discounts on movies and TV shows, discounted access to audiobooks, magazines, and digital books via Amazon Reads, and shopping "try before you buy" clothing items. Additionally, if you get the fee-free Prime Visa card, you can take advantage of cashback opportunities such as up to 5% back on eligible Amazon.com purchases and unlimited 3-5% on Amazon Fresh and Whole Foods Market purchases. The subscription to RxPass covers over 50 generic medications and offers free home delivery and 24/7 access to pharmacists. Subscription programs like Amazon's Subscribe and Save program can save up to 15% on everyday household household items and save money on items such as pet food, personal care, cat litter, pet products, and household items.

articles.title: Osprey Revamps Its Transporter™ Family with New Fabric Technology and Travel Carry Solutions
articles.description: Osprey, a leader in creating top-quality, high-performance innovative carry solutions, is introducing a fully redesigned series of Transporter™ bags for spring 2025. Rugged, reliable and responsibly made, the updated Transporter family will feature brand-new duffel, travel and lifestyle packs, each made from the innovative, 100% recycled and bluesign® approved NanoTough™ fabric technology.
articles.content:
Introducing NanoTough™ fabric and the Squffel™ option for all forms of travel adventure

CORTEZ, Colo., July 25, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Osprey, a leader in creating top-quality, high-performance innovat... [4178 symbols]
articles.summary: Osprey is launching a fully redesigned series of Transporter™ bags for spring 2025, featuring a new fabric technology called NanoTough™ fabric and the Squffel™ option. The updated Transporter family will feature new duffel, travel and lifestyle packs made from 100% recycled and bluesign® approved NanoT Tough™ fabric technology. The new fabric offers increased strength, abrasion resistance, water resistance, and improved overall performance. The first Transporter Squefel will be available in 44- and 70-liter volumes and comes with a split-case packing design, fold-away mesh dividers, wet and dry compartments, a pit zip-vented pocket to help air out contents. The full spring 2025 collection will be released at osprey.com and at specialty retailers in over 60 countries worldwide.

articles.summary: The results of a survey by WalkMe (NASDAQ: WKME), a leading provider of digital adoption solutions for navigating technology change, have revealed that digital Adoption Professionals (DAP professionals) are becoming key players in AI transformation, particularly in integrating AI into daily workflows. The survey also revealed that nearly 60% of DAP professionals are using AI products or solutions in their daily tasks, making processes more efficient and effective. The most common AI use case for DAP Professionals was for GenAI tools, with 38% indicating less than a quarter of their organization uses GenAI and another 15% indicating no GenAI use within their company. Over 7,000 professionals currently include WalkMe on their LinkedIn profiles, a 169% increase from 2020. Nomination is now open for the 2024 DAPP100.

articles.title: Circana Forecasts 2% Decline in U.S. Consumer Tech Sales for 2024 Amid Economic Pressures
articles.description: United States consumer technology sales revenue is now forecast to decline by 2% in 2024, reflecting underperformance in the first half of the year and unchanged macroeconomic conditions, according to the latest Future of Consumer Technology report from Circana™. Despite these challenges, Circana remains optimistic about growth in specific categories, such as notebook PCs and large-screen TVs, and expects overall industry growth to resume in 2025 and 2026.CHICAGO, July 25, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE)
articles.content: United States consumer technology sales revenue is now forecast to decline by 2% in 2024, reflecting underperformance in the first half of the year and unchanged macroeconomic conditions, according to... [4175 symbols]

keywords.name: United States consumer technology sales revenue

articles.summary: Circana™ has forecasted a 2% decline in U.S. consumer technology sales revenue for 2024 due to underperformance in the first half of the year and unchanged macroeconomic conditions. Despite these challenges, Circana remains optimistic about growth in specific categories such as notebook PCs and large-screen TVs, and expects overall industry growth to resume in 2025 and 2026. Most consumer technology categories underperformed in Q1 and continue to do so, suggesting a weaker outlook for Q2. However, Paul Gagnon, vice president and technology industry advisor, remains positive about the long-term outlook. Despite the overall cautious outlook, Circanas has seen signs of improving consumer demand.

Ivee joins TikTok’s Out of Phone initiative to help b... [4034 symbols]
articles.summary: Ivee, the mobility software provider creating premium passenger experiences in ride-hailing companies like Uber and Lyft, has announced a partnership with TikTok as part of the entertainment giant's Out of Phone initiative. The partnership will bolster joint sales opportunities and allow TikTok to license its premium short-form content to Ivee’s passenger infotainment system. This move allows brands to amplify on-platform content beyond mobile screens and into everyday life. The Iveee Ads product will be offered as an “add-on” for advertising buyers, allowing brands to reach broad audiences beyond the platform. The collaboration comes after IveE's successful rollout in markets such as NYC, LA, Miami, & Chicago on the Uber, Lyft, Via, and Blacklane networks.

articles.title: Elon Musk Finally Has His Everything App
articles.description: To the outside world, the former Twitter (now X) might look like it’s in decline. To its owner, it looks perfect.
articles.content: Is Twitter back? At The Atlantic, Charlie Warzel argues that while Twitter, now X, is a “rat’s nest of reckless speculation, angry partisans, and toxicity,” it’s also “alive in a way that’s hard to qu... [8919 symbols]
articles.summary: The Atlantic's Charlie Warzel and others have suggested that while Twitter, now X, is still alive in a way that's hard to quantify, while others argue that X is still relevant due to major breaking-news events such as Joe Biden's withdrawal from the presidential race. However, Casey Newton of Platformer disagrees, stating that while X is the "sunk-cost social network," it is still a "digital town square" with influential networks in various industries and affinity groups still present on X. Despite this, X is smaller than its predecessor, with established communities losing energy, reach, and audience. X remains the de facto breaking news platform for users to keep up with real-time events, but its business remains a mess. The primary interface for X shows a stark contrast between its future and its past, with the "For You" feed, which was made the default for users in early 2023. Despite these changes, the service remains largely undifferentiated product, making it less engaging and less engaging than other platforms.

articles.title: China’s Guangdong allows video gaming firms to test pre-licensed titles
articles.description: The new rule appears to provide an advantage to Shenzhen-based video gaming giant Tencent and major smartphone vendors that run app stores like Huawei, Oppo, Vivo and Honor.
articles.content: This initiative aims to “solve the actual difficulties faced by online game companies in testing their products”, the trade group had said. Video game publishers are only required to register in advan... [2322 symbols]
articles.summary: China's southern Guangdong province has allowed video gaming firms to test pre-licensed titles before receiving approval from the National Press and Publication Administration (NPPA). This move aims to address difficulties faced by online game companies in testing their products. Video game publishers are only required to register in advance with the province’s Press & Publication Bureau. This change represents an easing of strict industry regulations, which require a licence from the NPPA to publish new titles for smartphones, gaming consoles, and personal computers before these are released in the market. Lawyers and developers believe this change provides relief from the mainland's stringent licensing regime for video games.

articles.title: 10 best tripods for outdoor photography
articles.description: Once you experience the benefits of working with a tripod, you’ll immediately understand why choosing the right one is so important. Share this:Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window…
articles.content: Whether you’re a seasoned professional or just interested in grabbing some great shots in your spare time, a reliable tripod is a critical piece of gear for any outdoor photographer. From keeping your... [5611 symbols]
articles.summary: A reliable tripod is a crucial piece of gear for outdoor photographers, particularly for low-light photography. The best tripod for outdoor photography requires special consideration, with leg flexibility, stability, flexibility, and durability essential. Professional tripods are the most expensive, often made out of premium aluminum or carbon fiber, and are often built to high standards. They are also often marketed to established shutterbugs and often don't include any mounting accessories. Hobbyist tripods, often smaller and cheaper, are the best choices for most photographers. Mini and travel tripods can be purchased for less than half the cost, often designed to accommodate a lightweight digital camera or smartphone. The article also lists the 10 best tripods for outdoor photo.

articles.title: Best swimming pool dive toy
articles.description: Our team of experts has selected the best swimming pool dive toys out of dozens of options. Don’t buy a swimming pool dive toy before reading these reviews. Share this:Click to share on Faceb…
articles.content:
Which pool dive toys are best?

Do you know a little swimmer who loves playing in the pool? If they like practicing their underwater skills, pick up a set of swimming pool dive toys. They can have hou... [4960 symbols]
articles.summary: Swimming pool dive toys are a must-have toy for children who like playing in the pool and can teach them underwater skills. Popular designs include sticks, rings, balls with tails, and torpedos. If you plan to travel with these toys, it's worth buying a value set that includes a carry case with essential dive accessories. Well-made swimming pool diving toys are designed to withstand exposure to sunlight and pool chemicals, especially chlorine. They are usually made with bright colors that enhance their visibility and keep them visible through years of play. For advanced divers, choose toys that are susceptible to movement and are slow to sink, which can pose an extra dive challenge. Some of the best diving toys include a set of 30 diving toys for large groups of swimmers.

articles.title: ‘Fallout: London’: Here’s How To Get It Now, For Free
articles.description: After delays, hype, and rumors of its new launch date, ‘Fallout: London’ is finally here through a surprise drop from GOG.
articles.content: Fallout: London is finally here. After its planned April 23 release date was delayed–hampered by Bethesda’s next-gen Fallout 4 update, which rendered the mod unplayable–GOG has finally announced that ... [4277 symbols]
articles.summary: Fallout: London, a fan-created expansion to the Fallout universe, is now available for free download from GOG. Despite its release date being delayed due to Bethesda's next-gen Fallout 4 update, GOG has announced that Fallout: London is available for download for free. The expansion, which has been years in the making and takes the universe out of North America, has been released without a release date and features a new story, fully-voiced characters, new factions, Anglicised weaponry, and new gameplay elements. The game is set to be supported by a custom launcher in the future and requires owners of Fallout the Year Edition to downgrade their version to avoid tech issues. Despite the hype surrounding the release date, Fallout continues to rise, particularly amid reports that Fallout season 2 is ahead of schedule.

The offering, which can be purchased on any of the three streaming platforms’ websites, i... [2113 symbols]
articles.summary: Disney and Warner Bros. have launched their Disney+ Hulu and Max bundle in the U.S. It costs up to 38% compared to the price of services purchased separately. The service, which can be purchased on any of the three streaming platforms' websites, includes access to brands such as ABC, CNN, DC, Discovery, Disney, Food Network, FX, HBO, HGTV, Hulu, Marvel, Pixar, Searchlight, Star Wars, Warner Bros., and many more. The Disney+ standalone service is currently available for $7.99 per month with ads and $13.99 ad-free, while Hulu is available for between $7 and $17.99 a month without ads. Additionally, Comcast is offering its StreamSaver bundle to Xfinity customers for $15 per month, a savings of over 30%.

articles.title: The massive Fallout: London mod is now available
articles.description: Just be wary of the next-gen update.
articles.content: It’ll be some time before Bethesda releases a new Fallout game, but in the meantime, some enterprising fans have taken it upon themselves to release a big expansion for Fallout 4. The long-in-developm... [1471 symbols]
articles.summary: The long-anticipated mod, Fallout: London, has been released for free via GOG and is compatible with the Steam version of Fallout 4. The mod has been in development since 2019 and features a new location and story, with over 200 quests, and an estimated 90 hours of gameplay. However, users need to be using the version of the game before the recent next-gen update to play. A next-generation version is also in the works. The release comes at a good time as Fallout is being featured in the live-action series on Amazon Prime Video, which is getting a second season.

articles.title: What Advertisers Should Do Now: Google Reverses Decision To Eliminate Third-Party Cookies
articles.description: Google announced that it’s finally doing what everyone suspected and reversing its decision to deprecate third-party cookies in Chrome. After repeated delays in a four-year-long saga, marketers and advertisers grew increasingly skeptical.
articles.content: Google announced that it’s finally doing what everyone suspected and reversing its decision to deprecate third-party cookies in Chrome. After repeated delays in a four-year-long saga, marketers and ad... [3739 symbols]
articles.summary: Google has reversed its decision to deprecate third-party cookies in Chrome, a move that has been anticipated for four years. Despite this, 61% of B2C marketers believe Google will not deprecise the third party cookie. This decision allows Google to address key issues raised by the UK's antitrust regulator and data privacy regulator, including Privacy Sandbox, which is anticompetitive and lacks clear technical disclosures about how the data will be collected and used. The decision does not impact Privacy SandBox. While these issues have raised concerns for Google, other concerns include the use of Topics API for fingerprinting and user browsing. The following advice for advertisers is to keep testing and develop a data clean room partnership with publishers.

TEL AVIV, Israel, July 25, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- , a... [3907 symbols]
articles.summary: Israeli-based application security solution, Backslash Security, has introduced its Fix Simulation and AI-powered Attack Path Remediation capabilities. The new features extend the Backinglash platform across the full software development lifecycle. They provide safe, secure remediation guidance that can be implemented without introducing new risks. The platform also integrates with LLMs to provide highly contextual guidance on code vulnerability remediation, while ensuring source code stays confidential. These capabilities align with CISA’s requirements for maintaining security throughout the software development cycle. Backsash's fusion of SAST and SCA enables enterprise AppSec teams to focus on fixing only the reachable, exploitable code vulnerabilities. The company is backed by StageOne Ventures, First Rays Venture Partners, D. E. Shaw & Co., and a roster of security veterans.

articles.title: With Its Extended Pop-Up In Aspen, Revolve Group Continues Its In-Person Evolution
articles.description: Revolve may have built its empire as an e-commerce pioneer, but with the success of its Aspen pop-up, the retail giant is ushering in a future of in-person programming.
articles.content: For over a decade, Revolve Group has been synonymous with highly exclusive, influencer-only events and luxury trips to exotic locales. A pioneer of influencer marketing, the e-commerce behemoth made a... [6104 symbols]
articles.summary: Revolve Group, a leading influencer marketing company, has extended its in-person programming with a pop-up store in Aspen, Colorado. The Aspen shop, which opened in December, proved so successful that Revolve Group decided to keep its doors open indefinitely. Unlike previous pop-ups, this is the first time Revolve and FWRD are available to shop together under one roof. This collaboration allows the brand to reach its entire customer base simultaneously, appealing to different demographics. Chief Brand Officer Raissa Gerona is eager to further integrate both brands and showcase their vast production, brand, and price point selection on both sites.

Kraken solution optimizes full-motion video and metadata for transmission over any network for mission-critical workflows

MONTREAL, July 25, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Haivision Systems Inc. (“Haivisio... [3736 symbols]
articles.summary: Haivision Systems Inc. (Haivison) has released the Kraken real-time video processing platform for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) video workflows within defense. The solution optimizes full-motion video and metadata for transmission over any network for mission-critical workflows. Kraken blends software with hardware acceleration to efficiently encode, transcode, and transport high-quality, low-latency video and KLV metadata, even in environments where network bandwidth is unpredictable or limited. The latest release of Kraken features a newly designed user interface to improve usability, streamline operational efficiency, and provide real time insight into system performance. Kraken is a cornerstone solution in Haivision’s ISR video solutions portfolio, including the Makito X4 Rugged Video Encoder and Makito XP1 Rugged video Encoder.

articles.title: Marvell Teralynx 10 51.2T Ethernet Switch Enters Volume Production for Global AI Cloud Deployments
articles.description: Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: MRVL), a leader in data infrastructure semiconductor solutions, today announced that the Marvell® Teralynx® 10 Ethernet switch device is in volume production with customer deployments underway. The Teralynx 10 switch is a low power, programmable 51.2 Tbps Ethernet device with the industry's lowest latency1, delivering leading performance for training, inference, general-purpose compute and other workloads to scale accelerated infrastructure in cloud data centers
articles.content:
• None Unique architecture delivers high bandwidth, low latency, low power and programmability in a single platform for optimized cloud AI deployments.
• None Seamless support for open network operati... [9664 symbols]
articles.summary: Marvell Technology, a leader in data infrastructure semiconductor solutions, has announced that the Marvell Teralynx® 10 Ethernet switch device is in volume production for global AI Cloud Deployments. The unique architecture delivers high bandwidth, low latency, low power, and programmability in a single platform for cloud AI deployments. The switch is designed to meet the growing demand for high-bandwidth connectivity as the industry shifts from proprietary network operating systems to open network platforms like Linux Foundation's SONiC and SAI. Shipments of 51.2 Tbps switches are expected to increase from approximately 77,000 in 2024 to 1.8 million in 2028, a 120% compound annual growth rate (CAGR), a significant 120% increase in demand. The Tereynx 10 switch also supports seamless support for open network operating system software for fast design and deployment for ODMs, OEMs, and hyperscalers.
